document_type: ISO 27001 Security Requirements - Annex A Control
applies_to_note: All gambling operators subject to RTS Chapter 4 - Security Requirements

control.control_title: Addressing Information Security Within Supplier Agreements
control.control_purpose: To ensure relevant information security requirements are established and agreed with suppliers based on supplier relationship type
control.control_objective: Establish legal agreements with suppliers defining information security requirements appropriate to the relationship

iso_27001_definition.official_text: Relevant information security requirements should be established and agreed with each supplier based on the type of supplier relationship.
key_requirements: Information security requirements established for each supplier
Requirements agreed with supplier in writing
Requirements tailored based on relationship type
Legal mechanism in place documenting requirements
Requirements documented in supplier agreement or contract

supplier_agreements_overview.definition: Legal contracts or agreements establishing information security requirements for supplier relationships
supplier_agreements_overview.purpose: Legal mechanism binding both parties to agreed information security standards
supplier_agreements_overview.core_concept: First line of defence - legally binding agreement providing greatest protection
supplier_agreements_overview.scope: Applies to all suppliers providing products or services
supplier_agreements_overview.relationship_to_5_19: Control 5.19 addresses supplier management processes; 5.20 focuses specifically on legal agreements documenting requirements

implementation_requirements.requirement: Establish Supplier Agreement with Information Security Terms
implementation_requirements.description: All suppliers must have formal agreement in place addressing information security requirements

details.agreement_requirement: Every supplier engagement must be covered by contract, agreement, or terms of business
details.legal_mechanism: Agreement must be legally binding document
details.documentation: Maintain copy of agreement on file
details.status: Agreement must be in force and current
details.coverage: Agreement must cover services and products actually being used from supplier

implementation_requirements.requirement: Tailor Requirements Based on Supplier Relationship Type
implementation_requirements.description: Information security requirements must be appropriate to the type of supplier relationship

relationship_types: Cloud service providers - different from on-premise software vendors
Managed service providers - different from hardware suppliers
Data processors - different from service resellers
System integrators - different from maintenance contractors
Professional services - different from product vendors
tailoring_factors: Type of data accessed by supplier
details.principle: One-size-fits-all templates not appropriate - requirements scaled to risk

implementation_requirements.requirement: Include Clear Scope and Services Definition
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement clearly defines what services will be provided and scope of access

details.clarity: Specific rather than generic - describes actual services not general categories
details.purpose: Prevents scope creep and unauthorized access

implementation_requirements.requirement: Define Information Security Requirements
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement specifies information security controls and standards supplier must maintain

details.standards_reference: Reference to ISO 27001, specific certifications, or industry standards
details.specificity: Define minimum security levels required, not just general commitments

implementation_requirements.requirement: Address Legal, Regulatory and Contractual Compliance
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement addresses legal, regulatory and contractual requirements applicable to data

compliance_areas: Data protection and privacy regulations (GDPR, Data Protection Act)
details.specification: Agreement clearly allocates responsibility for compliance

implementation_requirements.requirement: Document Acceptable and Unacceptable Use of Assets
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement specifies what supplier can and cannot do with organization's assets and data

acceptable_use: Permitted uses of equipment and resources
unacceptable_use: Prohibited removal of data from specified location
Prohibited reuse of data for other purposes

implementation_requirements.requirement: Define Access Control and Management Procedures
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement specifies how access will be granted and removed

access_management: How access is requested and approved
details.segregation: Defines segregation of duties in access approval process

implementation_requirements.requirement: Include Personnel Security and Screening Requirements
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement specifies screening and vetting requirements for supplier personnel

details.legal_enforceability: Screening requirements must be legally enforceable

implementation_requirements.requirement: Define Audit and Monitoring Rights
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement grants organization right to audit supplier and verify compliance

audit_rights: Right to review audit reports and certifications
Right to review security assessment results
Access to audit logs and records

implementation_requirements.requirement: Address Evidence and Assurance of Information Security
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement specifies how supplier will provide evidence of information security

details.frequency: How often evidence must be provided
details.currency: Evidence must be current and relevant

implementation_requirements.requirement: Specify Penalties and Remediation for Non-Compliance
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement defines consequences for failure to meet information security requirements

penalty_types: Right to audit with increased frequency
details.indemnity: Indemnification clauses for losses resulting from supplier failures
details.remediation: Right to require remediation of non-compliance
details.liability: Clear allocation of liability for security failures

implementation_requirements.requirement: Include Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement specifies supplier's continuity and recovery commitments

details.obligations: Supplier responsible for maintaining and testing recovery capabilities

implementation_requirements.requirement: Define Change Management Process
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement specifies how changes to services or infrastructure are managed

details.critical_changes: Enhanced controls for changes affecting critical systems or data

implementation_requirements.requirement: Address Physical Security Standards
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement specifies physical security expectations for supplier facilities

implementation_requirements.requirement: Define Information Transfer Processes
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement specifies how information will be transferred securely

implementation_requirements.requirement: Include Termination and Exit Clauses
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement specifies procedures for terminating relationship and exiting services

details.data_handling: Clear procedures for secure handling of data upon termination
details.exit_verification: Verification that exit procedures completed successfully

implementation_requirements.requirement: Specify Data Destruction and Removal Processes
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement defines how data will be destroyed or removed upon termination

details.retention: Specify what data must be retained and for how long

implementation_requirements.requirement: Define Incident Handling and Notification
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement specifies how security incidents will be handled and reported

implementation_requirements.requirement: Include Contact Information
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement provides contact information for managing relationship

implementation_requirements.requirement: Address Conflict Resolution
implementation_requirements.description: Agreement specifies process for resolving disputes

supplier_agreement_template.description: Typical structure of comprehensive supplier information security agreement

sections.content: Description of services, systems access, data access, duration
GDPR compliance, data subject rights, processing obligations
How access is granted, managed, and removed
Audit rights, monitoring rights, reporting requirements
SLA, availability, disaster recovery, backup procedures
Notice periods, exit procedures, knowledge transfer
Key contacts for all relationship areas

steps.detail: Create policy requiring agreements with all suppliers
Create standardized template including information security terms
Identify all suppliers and status of agreements
Obtain signed agreements with all suppliers
Centralize storage of all supplier agreements
Track agreement status, renewal dates, version control
Have agreements reviewed by legal professionals
Plan annual reviews and updates of agreements

compliance_checklist.description: Steps to comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 5.20

checklist.item: Have written agreement with every supplier
Agreements address data handling on termination
All agreements documented in Supplier Register

common_mistakes.description: Top 3 mistakes organizations make with supplier agreements

mistakes.mistake: No contracts or legal terms with suppliers
mistakes.description: Operating with suppliers without formal agreements
mistakes.impact: No legal recourse if supplier fails security, no defined obligations
mistakes.prevention: Require written agreement for every supplier engagement
mistakes.action: Ensure copy on file, current, and covering services being used

mistakes.mistake: Generic agreements without information security terms
mistakes.description: Supplier agreements lacking specific security requirements
mistakes.impact: No clear security expectations, no enforcement mechanism
mistakes.prevention: Customize agreements with specific security requirements
mistakes.example: Agreement should specify encryption standard, not just 'appropriate security'

mistakes.mistake: Document and version control is wrong
issues: Multiple versions of agreement in circulation
mistakes.impact: Confusion about what agreements are in force

audit_requirements.description: What auditors will check during ISO 27001 A 5.20 audit

audit_areas.description: Auditor verifies agreements exist and include security terms
checks: Agreements are in force and current
Agreements cover termination and data handling
Agreements are appropriate for relationship type
audit_areas.easiest_win: Request list of suppliers and their agreements - missing agreements result in immediate findings

audit_areas.description: Verify agreements contain substantive information security terms
Verify agreements are current and reflect actual relationships
checks: New suppliers have agreements in place

audit_areas.description: Verify all suppliers documented and tracked

ukgc_application.critical_systems_context: Supplier agreements are critical legal mechanism for ensuring all suppliers maintain agreed information security standards for critical gambling systems

agreement_requirements: SOC 2 Type II audit report requirement

ukgc_application.compliance_requirement: Operators must have comprehensive written agreements with all suppliers addressing information security requirements appropriate to the relationship type and data accessed

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Establish legally binding agreements with suppliers defining information security requirements and ensuring accountability
compliance_notes.enforcement_priority: Critical - written agreements are primary legal mechanism for supplier security
key_principles: All suppliers must have written agreements
Agreements kept current and reviewed regularly

to_pass_the_audit.description: To comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 5.20 Addressing Information Security Within Supplier Agreements, implement

requirements.requirement: Have written agreement with every supplier
requirements.detail: Contract, agreement, or terms covering information security
Agreements reflect the nature and risk of each supplier relationship
Define controls and standards supplier must maintain
Specify GDPR and data protection obligations
Specify how incidents will be reported
Define data handling and exit processes
Have professional legal review of agreements

prerequisite_controls: ISO 27001 A 5.1 - Policies for information security
ISO 27001 A 5.19 - Information security in supplier relationships
cross_references: Supplier Relationships (A 5.19) - overall supplier management process
Supplier Service Delivery (A 5.20) - legal mechanism for defining requirements

agreement_drafting_practices: Obtain professional legal counsel for all agreements
Use organization's legal team or external counsel
Start with comprehensive templates tailored to your industry
Define clear scope and access limitations
Include data protection and privacy terms
Define audit and monitoring rights explicitly
Include penalties and remedies for non-compliance
agreement_management_practices: Maintain centralized repository of all agreements
Keep current versions only in active use
negotiation_practices: Understand acceptable security standards before negotiation
Be prepared to walk away if supplier unwilling to commit
Document any exceptions or deviations from standard
Get executive approval for any security compromises
renewal_practices: Update security requirements if standards changed

requirements: No unauthorized transfer to third countries

regulatory_expectations: UKGC expects comprehensive supplier agreements for all critical services
Written evidence of supplier security commitments mandatory
Particular emphasis on payment processor agreements
RNG supplier agreements must address game integrity
Data protection terms must comply with GDPR
Compliance approach should document key agreement terms for each critical supplier
Agreements must be enforced and monitored
